I blve that we are on course in Nigeria to improving access to Electricity. A little more patience + increased Gas supply will seal the deal
We will further meet our Gas requirements for Ughelli and its expansion for the next 30 years and longer
Through @TranscorpPLC s 281 Block, we will have enough to fuel our planned 1000MW a day
We know we can do more. We need Gas.
So when we @TranscorpPLC increase our output to 420MW its a serious step in bringing electricity to homes
I believe that all of us along the chain are working tirelessly to deliver increased access to electricity so that you can have power @ home
Electricity as you know it is brought to you by the DISCOS. It wouldnt be safe for electricity to come to you directly from the GENCOS
The voltage is scaled down along the way to a proportion which is suitable for use inside your homes.
Transmission of this electricity is done via the Transmission Company of Nigeria.
They are the last mile providers of electricity
Next in the supply chain is transmission of generated power to the distribution companies or the DISCOS as they are known
This has been a severe impediment to power generation and i'm sure all GENCOS have experienced the same severe constraints here
What the GENCOs cannot control however, is the supply of Gas to the plants. Gas comes primarily from the Nigerian Gas Company.
All to ensure that there is maximum output at their respective plants.
And Gas and water supply. Each GENCO now under private ownership has the responsibility to repair & install turbines & hire requisite staff
Lots of factors determine each GENCOs ability to generate power; viability of the turbines, technical & staffing capabilities on site ...
.@TranscorpPLC owns the Ughelli Power Plant in Delta State. We are a GENCO.
Electricity is fist generated by the generating companies - the "GENCOS" of which there are currently 6 privatized utilities
Let me shed some light on the process around power supply in Nigeria
We are doing our part to ensure the power situation in Nigeria changes ASAP @obinnaufudo @TranscorpPLC
Well done indeed ‚Äì & we‚Äôve only just begun. Ughelli has the capacity to produce 1000MW and we plan to expand that even further @obinnaufudo
